snippet: An advisory panel had recommended more research into implantable mesh used to treat urinary incontinence because of reports of serious injuries linked to the devices.
abstract: Food and Drug Administration issues order requiring makers of implantable surgical mesh used to treat urinary incontinence in women to study its risks; moves comes after years of reports of serious injuries linked to the devices.
lead_paragraph: An advisory panel had recommended more research into implantable mesh used to treat urinary incontinence because of reports of serious injuries linked to the devices.

headline.seo: F.D.A. Orders More Study on Surgical Mesh Risks
headline.main: F.D.A. Orders Surgical Mesh Makers to Study Risks
headline.print_headline: F.D.A. Orders Surgical Mesh Makers to Study Risks
